title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5905.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5905.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in these rules and regulations: (a) Act means the Federal Small Business

Innovation Development Act of 1982 ( P.L. 97-219). (b) Foundation means the New York State

Science and Technology Foundation, with headquarters at 99 Washington Ave., Albany, NY 12210. (c) Board means
the board of directors of the foundation. (d) Executive director means the executive
director of the foundation. (e) Staff means the staff of the foundation. (f) Federal agency means any Federal agency
which is required to make Small Business Innovation Research Awards pursuant to
the Act. (g) Federal SBIR Phase I
means the first phase of research conducted under a contract or grant award
made by a Federal agency, pursuant to the Act. (h) Federal SBIR Phase II means the second
phase of research conducted under a contract or grant award made by a Federal
agency, pursuant to the Act. (i) Firm means any small business which has received a Federal SBIR Phase I
research award. (j) State research
contract means the contract executed by the foundation with any firm judged to
have met the application requirements specified in section
5905.5
of this Part. (k) State-supported research means that
research to be conducted by the applicant using funds received pursuant to a

State research contract. (l) Qualified firm means a firm whose application for a State research contract has
been approved. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5905.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
